intro: Galium bourgaeanum subsp. maroccanum, commonly known as the Moroccan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its subspecific name, *maroccanum*, reflects its geographical origin in Morocco.
